capsules_submitted.utterance: Harry is definitely wearing glasses. I've seen him with them before, and he always seems to have a pair on when we're hanging out.
capsules_submitted.reply: i did not know that! i've never heard of someone wearing glasses before, valeria, can you tell me more about it?

capsules_submitted.utterance: So I was just talking to Harry and he's definitely wearing glasses. He looked pretty confident about it too.

Harry looks like he's wearing glasses, and I have to say, it suits him. I'm fairly certain that's what he's got on his face right now. The sentiment is neutral, but there's a hint of admiration in my tone. It's not surprising, really - Harry does look quite dashing with those specs on.
capsules_submitted.reply: that rings a bell. valeria told me that harry is wearing glasses.

capsules_submitted.utterance: I think Harry is really smart to wear glasses, it shows he's taking care of his eyesight. (CERTAINTY: 0.8) (POLARITY: POSITIVE) (SENTIMENT: NEUTRAL) (EMOTION: ADMIRATION)
capsules_submitted.reply: i am curious. what product did harry export?

capsules_submitted.utterance: So Harry is 11 years old. I'm pretty sure about that, and it's a fact that I can confirm.
capsules_submitted.reply: amazing! so harry and hermione are both eleven years old.

capsules_submitted.utterance: I've heard that Hermione is only 11 years old, but I'm not sure if that's really true. To be honest, it seems a bit young for someone who's already making such a big impact in the wizarding world.
capsules_submitted.reply: i just learned something, i've never heard of hermione before, but i'm so excited to learn more about this fascinating person!

capsules_submitted.utterance: You know, I've always been fascinated by Harry's story. He's truly the boy who lived, and it's incredible to think about what he went through at Hogwarts. I mean, can you imagine being famous in the wizarding world just because you're a target for Lord Voldemort? It's almost too much to handle. But despite all the challenges, Harry grew up to be an amazing young man, and his legacy continues to inspire people all over the world.
capsules_submitted.reply: valeria, i think i trust you.

capsules_submitted.utterance: You know, I've always been fascinated by Harry's story. He's truly "the boy who lived" - a legend in his own right. I mean, can you imagine being famous for surviving a killing curse as a baby? It's almost too incredible to believe. But at the same time, it's also kind of sad that he had to go through all that trauma from such a young age.
capsules_submitted.reply: i have heard this before. valeria, i remember you mentioning harry as "the boy who lived".

capsules_submitted.utterance: You know, I've always been fascinated by Harry's story. He's like a symbol of hope for many people, especially in the wizarding world. I mean, who wouldn't want to be "the boy who lived" after all? It's a title that carries so much weight and significance.
capsules_submitted.reply: if you don't mind me asking. what kind of personality does harry have?

capsules_submitted.utterance: So Flitwick is a female. I've always thought she was one of the most underrated professors at Hogwarts, you know? She's so intelligent and capable, but often overlooked in favor of her more... flashy colleagues. Anyway, it's good to confirm that, thanks for bringing it up!
